title: Understanding the Concept
text: In statistics, a statistic is a numerical value that represents a characteristic of a sample. It is used to estimate the corresponding parameter of the population.

title: Sample vs. Population
text: A sample is a subset of the population, and a statistic is a measure that describes this sample. The average score of the $$10$$ students is a statistic because it describes the sample, not the entire class.

title: Identifying the Correct Term
text: Given that the average score is calculated from a sample of $$10$$ students, what is this an example of?
